definition: readily/flatly (deny, admit and so on)/a mouthful/a bite
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
one breath/in one breath/at a stretch
to arbitrarily assert/to allege/to stick to one's statement/to cling to one's view
to heave a sigh of relief
to make a false countercharge
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: lit. you cannot get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. learn to walk before you run
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 bu4 cheng2 pang4 zi5

definition: erhua variant of 一口氣|一口气[yi1 kou3 qi4]
to gasp (with amazement or shock etc)/to feel a chill run down one's spine/to have one's hairs stand on end
pinyin: dao4 xi1 yi1 kou3 liang2 qi4

definition: to gasp (in surprise, dismay, fright etc)
lit. one-track path; fig. to adopt a unified approach to discussing an issue/to sing from the same hymn-sheet
to heave a sigh of relief

sentences.english: I can't wait to take a bite of the pumpernickel.
sentences.chinese: 我简直迫不及待想吃一口黑包。

sentences.english: One long swallow of the cold beverage cooled my sweating body.
sentences.chinese: 我咕噜噜长长地吞下一口冰凉的可乐。

sentences.english: I wolfed the whole two pounds of bread without stopping to take breath.
sentences.chinese: 我狼吞虎咽地一口气把整整两磅面包干掉了。

sentences.english: If you do, you will master the English language step by step.
sentences.chinese: 这样的话，你就能一步一步地说一口流利的英语了。

sentences.english: Rather the sun once connects the agreeable son carries of tea ugg tall drinks, superficial drank one one morsel.
sentences.chinese: 宁阳接过良儿端来的茶水，浅浅喝了一口。

sentences.english: The infection or venom from the bite could kill them.
sentences.chinese: 这一口带来的感染和毒液就可能杀死我的羊。

sentences.english: Victor has a very good voice and plays the violin very well.
sentences.chinese: 维特有一口好嗓音，而且小提琴也拉得很棒。

sentences.english: I know you're ready to speak English well.
sentences.chinese: 我相信你已准备好说一口漂亮的英语了。

sentences.english: Surprisingly, after chewing it for a bit, he found it sweetish and rather pleasant.
sentences.chinese: 当下伸手接过，咬了一口，咀嚼之下，倒也甘美可口。

sentences.english: Mrs. Dursley sipped her tea through pursed lips.
sentences.chinese: 德思礼太太嘬起嘴唇呷了一口茶。
深吸一口气，现在呼出来，再来一遍。

sentences.english: He took a deep draw on his pipe and tried again.
sentences.chinese: 他猛吸了一口烟，又试了起来。

sentences.english: Just roll it up and have a bite, Amy.
sentences.chinese: 把饼卷起来，咬一口尝尝吧，埃米。

sentences.english: What's the difference between the way Buy It Now and auction items are sorted in search results?
sentences.chinese: 在搜索结果中一口价和拍卖格式的排序有什么区别？

sentences.english: It’s funny how people’s obsessions come back to bite them.
sentences.chinese: 稀奇的是，执着的人们如何反咬一口。
他吸了一口气，强自镇定。

definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)/(to agree etc) unreservedly
to bite/to nip
variant of 咬[yao3]
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)
big mouthful (of food, drink, smoke etc)/open mouth/gulping/gobbling/gaping
mouth/in the mouth/on one's lips/speech/words
(coll.) to suck
(literary) to gnaw/to eat ravenously
saliva
to swallow/to suppress
the corners of the mouth/the lips
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
tip of tongue/apical
to open one's mouth (to eat, speak etc)/to gape/to start talking (esp. to make a request)
to chew/also pr. [jue2]
spittle/saliva
